com.anotherservice.rest.core

Class Request

  • Object
    • Request

  • public class Request
extends Object
    This class is part of the REST service and handles the requests in order to extract requires information and parameters.


    Using this class implies some notions :

    • The request URI is split at every slash ("/") and all ordered fragments are called actions. Those actions target a chain of Handler mappings that the Router will honor at best.
    • Every time an action is traversed, it is appended to the path. In short, actions are what is left to do, and the paths are what have already been done.
    • When the request is set using setBase(HttpServletRequest), all GET and POST parameters are parsed and merged in a final list of params. Thus, the Parameter class retrieves its values from here. All params are strings !. Moreover, params might contain multiple value, in which case those values are separated by a colon (","), semicolon (";"), or space. If the same parameter name is set in the GET and POST of the request, the value is merged using a semicolon (";") separator.


    All actions, paths, params are lowercase. When adding or retrieving any of those, the .toLowerCase() conversion is automatically applied.

    Author:
    Simon Uyttendaele
    Note:
    You may set actions, paths or params yourself to interfere with the routing process or handler execution. However, when not explicitely required, rather just not.

      • setBase

        public static void setBase(HttpServletRequest req)
                    throws Exception
        Parses the real HttpServletRequest. Extracts the actions and params for the current thread.
        Parameters:
        req - the HttpServletRequest
        Throws:
        Exception
        Note:
        You should not need to call this method manually. The Servlet does it for you

      • hasAttachment

        public static boolean hasAttachment()
        Checks if any attachment is present in the current request.
        Returns:
        true if at least one attachment exists (it doesn't mean it is valid). false otherwise

      • addAttachment

        public static void addAttachment(String name,
                 InputStream value)
        Adds an attachment with the specified file name and value.

        Important : If an attachment already exist with the provided file name, the new value is overwritten.

        Parameters:
        name - the file name of the param
        value - the value of the param
        Throws:
        RestException - if the name is null or empty
        Note:
        if the value is empty, it is converted to null

        public static InputStream getAttachment(String name)
        Gets the provided attachment value.
        Parameters:
        name - the file name of the attachment
        Returns:
        the param value or null if it is not found

      • addParam

        public static void addParam(String name,
            String value)
        Adds a param with the specified name and value.

        Important : If a param already exist with the provided name, the new value is appended to the previous using a semicolon (";") separator.

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the param
        value - the value of the param
        Throws:
        RestException - if the name is null or empty
        Note:
        if the value is empty null, it is converted to an empty string

      • getParam

        public static String getParam(Collection<String> names)
        Gets the first available param value.
        Parameters:
        names - the list of param names to consider
        Returns:
        the first param value found or null if none is found
        Note:
        if a name contains a delimiter colon (","), semicolon (";") or space, it is split and each part is used as well

        Returns:
        the first param value found or null if none is found
        Note:
        if a name contains a delimiter colon (","), semicolon (";") or space, it is split and each part is used as well

      • getParamNames

        public static Collection<String> getParamNames()
        Get the list of all parameters.
        Returns:
        the list of parameter names
        Note:
        Those parameters are sent by the user. Some might never be used by the underlying handler.

      • getCheckParam

        public static Object getCheckParam(Parameter rules)
                            throws Exception
        Gets the param value targetted by the provided rules.
        This method ensures that the parameter value recieved complies to a predefined set of rules.
        You should not need to call this method manually. It is called by Parameter.getValue() and Parameter.getValues().
        Parameters:
        rules - the Parameter definition
        Returns:
        the parameter value
        Throws:
        RestException - if any of the rules constraints are not satisfied
        Exception
        Note:
        this method will always return a Collection<String> if the parameter allows multiple values. However, that collection may be empty. On the other hand, if the parameter does not allow multiple values, then it may return null if the parameter is not set, or an empty String if the value is defined but empty.

      • skipAction

        public static void skipAction(int number)
        Skips leading actions
        Parameters:
        number - the number of actions to skip

      • hasAction

        public static boolean hasAction()
        Checks of there is another action to process.
        Returns:
        true if the remaining action list is not empty. false otherwise

      • addAction

        public static void addAction(String action)
        Appends an action to the list.
        Parameters:
        action - the action name
        Throws:
        RestException - if the action name is null or empty

      • addAction

        public static void addAction(String action,
             boolean back)
        Adds an action to the front or to the back of the list.
        Parameters:
        action - the action name
        back - if true the action is appended to the list, else it is added as first
        Throws:
        RestException - if the action name is null or empty

      • getAction

        public static String getAction()
        Pops the last action of the list. The retrieved action is added to the path
        Returns:
        the action name or null if there are no more actions

      • getAction

        public static String getAction(boolean back)
        Gets and removes the first or last action of the list. The retrieved action is added to the path
        Parameters:
        back - if true the action is popped from the list, otherwise the first one is taken
        Returns:
        the action name or null if there are no more actions

      • getAction

        public static String getAction(boolean back,
               boolean pop)
        Gets and eventually removes the first or last action of the list.
        Parameters:
        back - if true the last action is retrieved from the list, otherwise the first one
        pop - if true the action is removed from the list and added to the path
        Returns:
        the action name or null if there are no more actions
        Note:
        actions are normalized to lower case

        public static Collection<String> getActionParts()
        Returns all current action fragments
        Returns:
        the action fragments

        Returns all current path fragments
        Returns:
        the path fragments

      • getCurrentPath

        public static String getCurrentPath()
        Returns the current paths merged as a URI string.
        Returns:
        the current path URI or the root ("/") if the path is empty

      • getCurrentURI

        public static String getCurrentURI()
        Returns the remaining actions merged as a URI string.
        Returns:
        the remaining action URI or the root ("/") if the action list is empty

      • popPath

        public static String popPath()
        Pops the last path element.
        Returns:
        the last path element or null if there are none

      • resetPath

        public static void resetPath()
        Removes all elements of the path.

      • resetAction

        public static void resetAction()
        Removes all actions in the list.
